result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:19 AM Defendant Oscar I Perry in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas J McClure Esq in court for Oscar I Perry. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense believes he has discovery, and needs to meet with responsible DA to discuss offer. Defense requests a date in about 30 days. 

Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Julian Marrufo, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Thomas J McClure in court, defendant Oscar I Perry not in court, in custody.   
Attorney McClure is willing to waive his client's appearance.

Defense is requesting a new date.
Defense is still waiting on some discovery, further investigation and negotiations with the State.
  Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:11 AM Defendant Oscar I Perry in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas J McClure.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases called for status. 
Defense had requests Huber Bailee status. Due to current circumstances, that is not a viable option.
Defense is looking for a global offer, but anticipates a resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Oscar I Perry
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 03-31-2022)
Prior: 1220 Prairie Creek Blvd Apt 101, Oconomowoc, WI 53066

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

02:49 PM Defendant Oscar I Perry in court, in custody, with attorney Angela Wang.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation, if defendant remains in custody and looses his job.  An attorney will be appointed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 08:15 am.
